page.title: 02THE PONTESBURY BUTCHER'S
page.content: The butcher's shop has been in Pontesbury for over a hundred years. It is open for nine hours every day, except Sunday. The butcher fetches some meat from the abbatoir and buys more from other wholesalers,he no longer slaughters on the premises. Before he opens his shop in the morning he has to clean the surfaces of the tables. Then he cuts the meat and puts it on display in the front of the window. He checks the prices and prepares the tills. Most of the customers are regulars. The most popular meats are pork, lamb and minced beef and customers buy joints for Sunday lunch. He employs fifteen people and finds that people now prefer to buy meats which are quick to prepare and cook, like sausages, steaks and beefburgers.
